sentence.Network_en: She took a sip of water to moisten her dry throat.
sentence.Network_cn: 她抿了一口水，润一下发干的喉咙。

sentence.Network_en: His tongue even strayed out to moisten them.
sentence.Network_cn: 他甚至不知不觉地伸出舌头来舔舔嘴唇.

sentence.Network_en: Her eyes moisten as she listen to the sad story.
sentence.Network_cn: 听著这悲伤的故事,她的眼睛湿润了.

entry.def: To moisten something means to make it slightly wet.

example.ex: She took a sip of water to moisten her dry throat.
example.tran: 她抿了一口水，润一下发干的喉咙。

auth_sentence.content: Pour on remaining oil, repeat stirring to moisten ingredients.
auth_sentence.res_content: Pour on remaining oil, repeat stirring to moisten ingredients.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Pour on remaining oil, repeat stirring to moisten ingredients.

auth_sentence.content: You moisten my head with oil, my cup overflows.
auth_sentence.res_content: You moisten my head with oil, my cup overflows.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: You moisten my head with oil, my cup overflows.

auth_sentence.content: If it is, add a splash of milk to moisten lightly.

sentences.en: Although I moistened it,the flap doesn’t stick to the envelope.
sentences.cn: 我把信封弄湿了,可是信封口盖还是粘不上。

sentences.en: He nervously moistened his lips with his tongue.
sentences.cn: 他紧张地用舌头润了润唇。
